p: Retroviruses and lentiviruses are ssRNA, which can provide long-term transgene expression by integration into the host genome. They have frequently been used as gene therapy vectors for indications such as glioma [ 77, 78], and breast [ 81], gastric [ 82], liver [ 83], pancreatic [ 84], and hematologic [ 85] cancers. One limitation of using retroviruses such as Moloney murine leukemia virus (MoMLV) for gene therapy is the requirement of cell division for transduction and integration [ 125]. In contrast, lentiviruses are capable of transduction of both dividing and non-dividing cells.
